description: Coined by British zoologist Ray Lankester in 1870, from homo- +‎ -plasy, formed from Ancient Greek ὁμός (homós, “similar, alike, the same”) and πλάσσω (plássō, “to shape, to mold”).

entries.meaning: (evolutionary theory) A correspondence between the parts or organs of different species acquired as the result of parallel evolution or convergence.
